meanings.sent1: The steam turned into water, showing that it was condensible.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used a special machine to test if the gas was condensible.
meanings.sent3: The cloud looked like a fluffy, condensible pillow in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were so condensible, they formed a clear and concise plan.
meanings.sent5: The snow was so condensible, it packed tightly into a snowball.

meanings.definition: Able to be made more compact or dense.
meanings.sent1: The suitcase was designed to hold condensible items for travel.
meanings.sent2: The foam mattress was condensible, allowing it to be rolled up for storage.
meanings.sent3: The dough was so condensible, it fit perfectly into the baking pan.
meanings.sent4: His schedule was condensible, with back-to-back meetings all day.
meanings.sent5: The clay was condensible, making it easy to shape into different forms.
